cab.content: (This Document is the Property olHis Britannic Majesty'^ Government.)SECRET.OPERATIONS^21tJ hi XProm:- General Delme Radcliffe, Italy. To:- C .I.G.S,, 17ar Office.Handed in 12.40 a,i:i.; Reed. 10.10 a.m. 21st Novemoer; 1917.735. November 20th. This evening's report..3rd Army front: At 6.30 this morning Italians afterartillery preparation attacked the enemy''s positions in Zensonsalient and succeeded in taking whole river bank. Entire posi-tion gained could not be held owing to enemy!s heavy fire.On remainder of front nothing of importance.4th Army. Near Fendemici enemy has thrown a foot-bridge across Piave; it is kept under fire of Italian artillery.Last night Italians extended their hold on Monfeners, Repeated enemy counter-attacks were repulsed. At dawn the enemy opened heavy bombardment on positions held. About 9.30 a.m. column equivalent to one division was observed, moving west along the Feltre St. Lucia Campo road.1st Army, Enemyls attacks against advanced posts of the 20th Corps repulsed..Considerable enemy artillery fire directed on Monte Zomo and Frenzela Valley and the slopes of Sisemol.Increased enemy artillery fire in the Lagarina valley reported.3rd Army Corps. Slight artillery activity.
